intro: Oreodoxa oleracea, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning and close by midday. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces spiral-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found growing along roadsides and in disturbed soils. Oreodoxa oleracea is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
